summary: Peter maximoff is based off Pietro Allen of amalgum comics and should be called MERCURY and not quicksilver cause the only thing...
body:
Hot take

Peter maximoff is based off Pietro Allen of amalgum comics and should be called MERCURY and not quicksilver cause the only thing quicksilver about him is his power and his dad every thing else has been too Americanized plus it explains his speed basically being akin to that of the flash

Pietro Maximoff is the one true QUICKSILVER based of Pietro Lensherr of the ultimate universe in both top speed and even some design

So in conclusion Even Peters should be called Mercury and Aaron Johnson should be the Quicksilver

summary: All this "Loki was never really a villain! I knew my baby was a good boi all along" business really speaks volumes about fandom...
body: All this “Loki was never really a villain! I knew my baby was a good boi all along” business really speaks volumes about fandom culture nowadays. People are so afraid of making “problematic” likeable characters that they just don’t bother to at all! Why do you fear actual flaws in characters so much?! You can still like evil characters! You don’t have to justify why you like them!

reblog.comment: All this “Loki was never really a villain! I knew my baby was a good boi all along” business really speaks volumes about fandom culture nowadays. People are so afraid of making “problematic” likeable characters that they just don’t bother to at all! Why do you fear actual flaws in characters so much?! You can still like evil characters! You don’t have to justify why you like them!

You don’t have to justify why you like them!

People are so afraid of making “problematic” likeable characters that they just don’t bother to at all! Why do you fear actual flaws in characters so much?! You can still like evil characters! summary: Things that probably happened in the Avengers Tower
body:
Things that probably happened in the Avengers Tower

  • Let’s be honest they’re all fucked in their own ways
  • Random rockets shooting out from Tony’s lab
  • Thor always yelling “WHO ATE MY POPTARTS?” *aggresive thunderstorm begins outside*
  • Bruce being the only mature and sane person
  • Captain is the second sane person but not that mature
  • Steve always dancing to songs that sounds like it was made in the 40’s
  • hello my baby hello my honey🎶🎶
  • heLLo mY RagTiMe gAL
  • ALWAYS
  • ANYTIME AND EVERYWHERE
  • at the gym
  • At tony’s lab
  • At the kitchen
  • Probably even in battle
  • Clint crawling in the vents to get dat hot tea
  • Clint seeing the avengers as the kardashians
  • Keeping up with the avengers™️
  • Natasha and clint playing hide and seek in the airducts
  • P A P R I K A E V E R Y W H E R E
  • Thor always coming to steve for emotional comfort
  • “My brother tried to kill me again”
  • “It’s the fifth time this week thor”
  • Bruce leaving his experiments with a dont touch sign but they still touch it
  • “Bruce my hand is stuck in your yellow blob again”
  • One of the avengers breaking one of tony’s expensive suits and trying to cover it up with a bunch of blankets
  • Probably Clint or Thor
  • “If I can’t see it then it didn’t happen.”
  • The avengers getting so drunk that they reenact the first avengers movie, starring loki
  • Loki enjoying it too much to not agree
  • The avengers waking up the next day with fury infront of them. Reconsidering the Avengers Initiative.

Tbh, i dont know if writing this cheered me up after infinity war or just made me sadder

- Admin Chelsea & Natalia

title: Breathe No More
body:
How did you go from there to have him buried between your legs?

Too Sharp To Put Back Together

The psychiatrist’s office is probably the worst place ever to meet someone.But it was where it happened.How did you go from there to have him buried between your legs it was another matter…

Read more…

title: Headcannon Spider-Man
body:
If Peter Parker ever decided to ditch superhero-ing, becomes a bit selfish and all. Or at least when he knew Spider-Man is not needed in a fight.

No one can convince me otherwise that he won’t sit at the edge of a fight, chilling, while taking some epic pictures of the fight like life couldn’t be any easier.

Of course, He’d get many shits from the worried superheroes for it- which would be a semi-urban legend around the heroes circle about a crazy, suicidal, but genius photographer that could be found lounging around a fight, taking pictures. That’s how Avengers, X-Men, Fantastic Four, and other superheroes (plus some anti heroes) knew about Peter Parker.

summary:
Day 103: Seven of Marvel  

Seven of Nine as Captain Marvel.  Is Seven just playing on the holodeck? Or did Starfleet meet Star...
caption:
Day 103: Seven of Marvel 

Seven of Nine as Captain Marvel.

Is Seven just playing on the holodeck? Or did Starfleet meet Star Force, and result in Seven taking over the mantel after Carol Danvers retires? Or is Seven just dressing up as an Avenger to honor the fact that their series finales share the same title (and in all likelihood, time travel)? Some other scenario? Interpret as you like.

Ideally I’d have saved this for a day that had the number 7 (and preferrably 9) somewhere in the countdown, but life’s too short. I fell behind, and realized this one was practically finished, so I readied it for posting.

54 days to “Captain Marvel,” 103 days to “Avengers: Endgame”

summary: Avengers  #12 (2019)  // Marvel Comics THE ALL-NEW SECRET AVENGERS! It’s hard to run the Avengers without a support staff. And...
caption:
Avengers  #12 (2019)  // Marvel Comics

THE ALL-NEW SECRET AVENGERS! It’s hard to run the Avengers without a support staff. And for a team as wild, weird and insanely powerful as this new Avengers squad, just one Jarvis would never do. Luckily, Black Panther has assembled the wildest and weirdest support staff you’ve ever seen. Meet Gorilla Man, Ka-Zar and the rest of the Agents of Wakanda.

Story: Jason Aaron, art: Ed McGuinness, Cory Smith

Get it now here

[Follow SuperheroesInColor faceb / instag / twitter / tumblr / pinterest]

title: 30 Minutes
body:
You are certain you love the man who will soon be your husband, right?

Plans Or Mistakes

You closed and locked the door behind you in the small room. You were immediately assaulted by hands, mouth and a body that pressed you hard against the wall.“How long until the party starts?” You…

blog.name: booksaresacredspew
blog.title: Often Undecided
blog.description:
Fandoms: Star Wars, Harry Potter, Stargate SG1, Doctor Who, Sherlock, Lord of the Rings, Merlin, the Vorkosigan Saga, Marvel/Avengers, misc. other books and movies and shows.
Favorite Characters: Obi-Wan Kenobi, Daniel Jackson, Miles Vorkosigan, Hermione Granger
Favorite thing in general: context

tags: even the bad guys sometimes have a bit of the truth
also please no one get overly offended by this?
I may have called out a lot of fics with specific plot things
but I read and enjoyed most of those
so like even if you wrote a fic like what I described
I was not trying to attack you
just to challenge you to do even better than what you have done in the past
summary: You know what I love in stories, but never get enough of? Ppl who’ve fucked up getting learning the error of their ways. And...
body:
You know what I love in stories, but never get enough of? Ppl who’ve fucked up getting learning the error of their ways. And being complicated people while doing it. Not just the regular villains. You see villains getting the redemption arcs and “misunderstood and misguided but working to be better now” shit all the time, in canon and in fic. But then there’s the ppl in charge of the good guys who also fuck up, and often get bashed in fic. And I don’t disagree that they deserve it in those stories.

But the thing is, so often I see these characters who are nominally on the side of good but who have fucked up so much, when their bullshit is pointed out to them, simply ignore it or rationalize it away. They keep to their narrow mindsets they’ve constructed, and make the other characters, the “true heroes” out to be the bad guys in their minds. Forcing the heroes to just steamroll over them, sidelining them or completely destroying them. And this works for the stories, because we get a secondary antagonist who is thoroughly put down and shamed, and that’s all well and good.

But what I want is for them to see and understand. I want them to get that they’ve fucked up, and start to try to change. Life is boring if ppl are static, it’s disappointing when people don’t learn from their mistakes. But life is beautiful when people grow from their experiences, and strive to be better.

Examples. Dumbledore is a common scapegoat, because damn a lot of his decisions in canon were hella sketchy. Placing Harry with the Dursleys, number one. Abuse, physical or mental, and unarguable neglect happened in that house. Especially when one considers the new stuff about Obscurials and what Dumbles knew about them, this decision is… shall we say, highly questionable. However, I still believe that Albus was simply a man who tried to do the right thing and made a mistake. Many mistakes, really. I think that he was probably really, deathly scared for Harry’s life right after Voldy hit the wind. And he didn’t know the full extent of Petunia’s hatred. For all we know, his last knowledge of Petunia was that she sent a letter to him after Lily got hers, wanting to be allowed into Hogwarts. And considering that Lily’s protection of Harry was powered by her love for him (or that’s how Dumbles explains it), if the blood relatives he was placed with had loved him it probably would have been even more powerful. The most powerful protection ever. Dumbledore had every reason to hope like hell that Petunia’s love for her sister would carry over to her son. That it didn’t, and Harry was not treated well as a result, Dumbledore probably regretted to and beyond his grave. But by the time he was aware of it (we’re ignoring for now Mrs. Figg and how he didn’t seem to check up on Harry enough) and able to do something, Voldemort had made an appearance for the first time in a decade, and that blood protection was obviously still needed.

And I’m getting off track, sorry. So I see a lot of fics where Dumbles gets bashed. Sometimes he’s made out to be a lot more manipulative, and sometimes outright evil, than I think he was in canon. And I go along with it, because dang he made a lot of sketchy decisions, not just the one I mentioned before, and it is believable he could have done even more sketchy stuff. But in the ones where he’s not quite evil, just misguided and Machiavellian, he almost never really gets to repent and change. Like he just keeps on doing dumb shit while the heroes of the fic do stuff behind his back and resent him, and at some point he gets yelled at for his shit. And maybe he blinks a bit at this outburst, but more often than not he then starts trying to talk down to the person yelling, like they’re the dumb ones and he knows best and they should listen to him. Like he hasn’t learned anything at all from the beatdown. And it just isn’t as satisfying to have someone give verbal destruction to a guy who deserves it if said guy doesn’t even seem to take it in, you know? I want a misguided good person, who when the heroes give them hell for all the shit they’ve pulled, sits down and has a good think about what the heroes said, realizing they maybe had a point, and then feels bad about it and tries to make up for it. That would be much more satisfying.

Another example I see a lot of is in Avengers fic? Like Civil War, I hate Civil War, because many of the fix-its are on Team Tony, and that’s great, I love Tony, I love Tony-centric fics, it’s awesome. But here’s the thing: I also love Steve. And many Tony-centric stories tend to vilify Steve. And I can handle it, especially since a lot of his actions and those of the rest of the team in canon can be interpreted as not-so-good especially where Tony’s concerned. But, but but. That’s not who Steve is. He’s the guy who wants to do the right thing, who hates bullies. He’d be horrified at the thought that he’d turned into one. And in a lot of fics that’s exactly what he is. And Tony’s not 100% perfect, either. Plus there were miscommunications on both sides of that clusterfuck, which didn’t help. I want a fix-it where they’re both kind of right, and both kind of wrong, and the ending of Civil War in Siberia never happened because what the fuck. What the actual fuck, anyway.

So, a challenge: Bash the characters, sure. You see something they did was problematic and you want to call them out on it? Go ahead. But then have them realize and understand what they did wrong, and work to fix it. Points if you show them as complicated individuals who had valid reasonings for what they did, and were right about a couple of things even though they were wrong on a lot. Bonus points if they point out (or the hero realizes) how the hero also fucked up a bit here and there. Because people are dumb, and people are narrow-minded and petty and can get caught in circular reasoning and all sorts of things. But people can change. They grow and learn and they strive to be better in all things. And that’s what makes life beautiful.
